content: This is a great list. I think, though, that it’s important to cite case studies that back up all or each of these points if possible. There’s a handy link to Nielsen Norman Group on using placeholder as labels (which in turn provides quantitative data and links to relevant research), but this is for one of many points. I’m not saying that these points are invalid, of course, as I said they all seem to make sense — it’s just that in the ever-changing digital landscape (I’m aware forms are not exclusively digital) it’d help provide an idea of how relevant the user impact is at any given time whether that’s now or at any point in the future. A good post nonetheless. Nice work :)
